intro: Tridactyle sarcodantha, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in humid, well-drained soil. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Tridactyle sarcodantha is prized for its compact size and ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
